PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Calculation of the yield of anaerobic digestion plants and researching of systems for improve the process and its products
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Biogas is a biofuel produced by a fermentation of organic substrates by microbes under anaerobic condition and it is a mixture of gases; it consists mainly of methane (CH4) and carbon dioxide (CO2). The gases formed are the waste products of the respiration of these decomposer microorganisms and the composition of the gases depends on the substance that is behind decomposed;methane makes up the combustible part of biogas. Compared with the aerobic decomposition of organic matter, the energy yield of anaerobic process is smaller. The growth rate of anaerobic bacteria is considerably lower that than aerobic bacteria and that the production of new biomass is less per gram decomposer organic matter. The biogas process is divided into three steps: Hydrolysis, Fermentation-Acidogenesis and Methanogenesis, where different groups of bacteria are each responsible for a step.
The main topic of the research is the definition of the different type of anaerobic process, which difference depend of the alimentation to anaerobic digester. After a first introduction of the theme continues with the study of various companies, the calculation of returns and the search for solutions to improve performance and products of the process.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Biogas Plants feeded by cattle manure 100 kWe, 250 kWe

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Wood gasification provides an important alternate renewable energy resource for power generation, it can reduce CO2 production and decrease the dependence on fossil fuels. The purpose of the thesis consists of wood biomass study and wood gasification process analysis for energy production. Lignocellulosic biomass classification and their worldwide, European and Italian availability are presented. Wood gasification and some technologies useful for the process are analyzed, in particular is studied an existent wood gasification plant of 1,2 MW electrical power and it is located in Ru e, near Maribor (Slovenia) surrounded by woods which uses internal combustion engine for power production. Finally, process efficiencies, energy power and emission from power plant are evaluated.
Energy Optimization of an existing 2.5 MW electrical biogas plant

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: BIOGAS PRODUCTION FROM CO-DIGESTION OF CAST SEAWEED AND ORGANIC RESIDUES
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The worldwide increase of energy demand is often coupled with detriments to the environment. Unlike the global trend, Solr d municipality has joined the need of energy production to a sustainable development. Animal by-products, industrial residues and cast seaweed are turned into valuable products for biogas production. Characterization of the substrates did not highlight any main drawback for the purpose of biogas production. Only high cadmium concentration have been detected in some of the samples of analysed cast seaweed. Anaerobic digestion of each substrate and co-digestion of all of them was tested at different volatile solids concentration. Continuous experiment in 5 L stirred tank reactors followed biomethane potential tests. High level of ammonia and sulphur may be problematic, but the process results to be table at any tested concentration. Achieved methane yield was 184.8 17.1 ml CH4 gVS-1 in case of co-digestion of cattle manure and cast seaweed (organic loading rate of 2.5 gVS L-1 d-1) and 210.8 16.4 ml CH4 gVS-1 for sugar beet pulp, cast seaweed and cattle manure (OLR of 2 gVS L-1 d-1).
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: BIOGAS PRODUCTION FROM CO-DIGESTION OF CAST SEAWEED AND ORGANIC RESIDUES
